intro: Rauvolfia senegambiae, commonly known as African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its roots are traditionally used in herbal medicine for their hypotensive properties. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
